verses.text: Josiah \add was\add* eight years old when he began to reign , and he reigned thirty and one years in Jerusalem. And his mother’s name \add was\add* Jedidah , the daughter of Adaiah of Boscath.

And he did \add that which was\add* right in the sight of the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*, and walked in all the way of David his father , and turned not aside to the right hand or to the left. \p

¶ And it came to pass in the eighteenth year of king Josiah , \add that\add* the king sent Shaphan the son of Azaliah , the son of Meshullam , the scribe , to the house of the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*, saying ,

Go up to Hilkiah the high priest , that he may sum the silver which is brought into the house of the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*, which the keepers of the door have gathered of the people :\f + \fr 22.4 \ft door: Heb. threshold\f*

And let them deliver it into the hand of the doers of the work , that have the oversight of the house of the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d*: and let them give it to the doers of the work which \add is\add* in the house of the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d*, to repair the breaches of the house ,
Unto carpenters , and builders , and masons , and to buy timber and hewn stone to repair the house.
Howbeit there was no reckoning made with them of the money that was delivered into their hand , because they dealt faithfully. \p

¶ And Hilkiah the high priest said unto Shaphan the scribe , I have found the book of the law in the house of the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*. And Hilkiah gave the book to Shaphan , and he read it.

And Shaphan the scribe came to the king , and brought the king word again , and said , Thy servants have gathered the money that was found in the house , and have delivered it into the hand of them that do the work , that have the oversight of the house of the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*.\f + \fr 22.9 \ft gathered: Heb. melted\f*
And Shaphan the scribe shewed the king , saying , Hilkiah the priest hath delivered me a book. And Shaphan read it before the king. \p
And it came to pass, when the king had heard the words of the book of the law , that he rent his clothes.

And the king commanded Hilkiah the priest , and Ahikam the son of Shaphan , and Achbor the son of Michaiah , and Shaphan the scribe , and Asahiah a servant of the king’s , saying ,\f + \fr 22.12 \ft Achbor: or, Abdon\f*\f + \fr 22.12 \ft Michaiah: or, Micah\f*

Go ye, enquire of the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d* for me, and for the people , and for all Judah , concerning the words of this book that is found : for great \add is\add* the wrath of the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d* that is kindled against us, because our fathers have not hearkened unto the words of this book , to do according unto all that which is written concerning us.

So Hilkiah the priest , and Ahikam , and Achbor , and Shaphan , and Asahiah , went unto Huldah the prophetess , the wife of Shallum the son of Tikvah , the son of Harhas , keeper of the wardrobe ; (now she dwelt in Jerusalem in the college ;) and they communed with her.\f + \fr 22.14 \ft wardrobe: Heb. garments\f*\f + \fr 22.14 \ft in the…: or, in the second part\f* \p
¶ And she said unto them, Thus saith the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* God of Israel , Tell the man that sent you to me,

Thus saith the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*, Behold, I will bring evil upon this place , and upon the inhabitants thereof, \add even\add* all the words of the book which the king of Judah hath read :

Because they have forsaken me, and have burned incense unto other gods , that they might provoke me to anger with all the works of their hands ; therefore my wrath shall be kindled against this place , and shall not be quenched.

But to the king of Judah which sent you to enquire of the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d*, thus shall ye say to him, Thus saith the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d* God of Israel , \add As touching\add* the words which thou hast heard ;

Because thine heart was tender , and thou hast humbled thyself before the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d*, when thou heardest what I spake against this place , and against the inhabitants thereof, that they should become a desolation and a curse , and hast rent thy clothes , and wept before me; I also have heard \add thee\add*, saith the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d*.

Behold therefore, I will gather thee unto thy fathers , and thou shalt be gathered into thy grave in peace ; and thine eyes shall not see all the evil which I will bring upon this place. And they brought the king word again.
